edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject

Class AddAmmoPowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Item
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.AddAmmoPowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class AddAmmoPowerUp
extends Item
    This class will be used to generate objects that represent specific powerup in the game that adds a single bullet to the player's Gun. It extends the class Item, and thus it inherits Item's location field (an array of 2 integers, holding values for the item's x-coordinate and y-coordinate on the map grid) and its method (which is abstract in the superclass), activate().
    Author:
    Team Jedi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddAmmoPowerUp(int x, int y)
      This constructor will call the Item constructor and will set the location for the AddAmmoPowerUp to be set to (which would have been randomly generated).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddAmmoPowerUp

        public AddAmmoPowerUp(int x,
              int y)
        This constructor will call the Item constructor and will set the location for the AddAmmoPowerUp to be set to (which would have been randomly generated). It calls the method's superclass's constructor with two parameters to be used to set the powerup's location on the map for later reference.
        Parameters:
        x - the integer representing the item's x-coordinate on the grid
        y - the integer representing the item's y-coordinate on the grid

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        public void activate(Gun g)
        This method will be called whenever the player moves over (and picks up) an ammunition powerup. The method will call the gainAmmo() method of the Gun g (which represents the player's gun) to raise the number of bullets it contains by 1.
        Parameters:
        g - is the Gun object that represents the player's gun, which will have its ammunition count raised by 1
